title: Self-defense in road rage cases - lawyers, police, politicians, please help!
selftext:
In the backdrop of the Bengaluru incident of road rage, where a bunch of goons chased after and beat up someone for simply honking at them, I would like to know what our legal options for self-defense are. Link to incident: [https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/videos/toi-original/caught-on-cam-car-damaged-in-road-rage-incident-in-bengaluru/videoshow/101743873.cms](https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/videos/toi-original/caught-on-cam-car-damaged-in-road-rage-incident-in-bengaluru/videoshow/101743873.cms)

How helpful are the police in this regard?

How do we defend ourselves until the police come? What are some legal self-defense weapons that don't require licenses/documentation etc.?

What if the offenders get bail and come to threaten the complainant or carry out more violence?

A lot of us are genuinely scared. 

If there are any lawyers, police people, or politicians out here, I humbly request you to please respond to my questions!

Your answers will be genuinely appreciated.

\- an ordinary Bengaluru resident
comments: My title meets your requirements. Please don't remove this post!

Similar queries have been answered on r/LegalAdviceIndia 

Additionally, I reckon that the above sub would be a better place for getting suitable answers.

I suppose guns help solve this immediately. Tax payers need to be given guns. As it is we get shit in return and zero security. Might as well frikin shoot the balls off of anyone who tries to frck around.
Do you want school shootings? Because that’s exactly how you get school shootings.
I genuinely believe that Indians should learn how to sucker punch for self defence.

One needs to make themselves as strong as possible to deal with such challenging situations.

There is no one answer, but in a seriously dysfunctional & unequal law & order society, we need to take every step we can to look out for ourselves & our loved ones. 

Else, we risk becoming a statistic on the crime ratio/chart of our society.

The first rule is to never, ever, ever get out of the car or unlock the doors. You're safe inside your vehicle. Try to leave the situation immediately if you can and drive straight to a police station or a public crowded place.
